title: U.S. consumer usage of mobile payments 2017
summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Made a mobile payment and lowest at Response Sent money internationally.
There is a difference of 62.0 between the maximum Response Made a mobile payment and minimum Response Sent money internationally.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Made a mobile payment and lowest at Response Sent money internationally.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Made a mobile payment and lowest at Response Sent money internationally.
There is a difference of 62.0 between the maximum Response Made a mobile payment and minimum Response Sent money internationally.
max_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
Response Made a mobile payment has the highest Share of respondents and Sent money internationally has the lowest Share of respondents.
Response Paid a bill has the second highest value for Share of respondents.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Response is 62.0.
Share of respondents at Response Made a mobile payment is 64.0 , second place is Paid a bill at 49.0, and thirdly is Purchase in-app or online at 44.0.
The Response Sent money internationally tends to be 2.58 percent lower than average.
Summing up the values of all Responses, we get total 248.0.
